intro: Laggera gariepina, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. It features narrow, silvery-green leaves and produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in spring. Laggera gariepina is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
